item.title: Keep an eye on these educational reforms in 2024
item.description: Recently, we published an overview of South Carolina's national rankings across different performance indicators in education. We found that South Carolina lags behind other states when it comes to test scores, graduation rates, and reading proficiency for eighth-grade students.
item.author: sam@scpolicycouncil.org (Sam Aaron)

item.title: South Carolina's educational shortcomings (and a brighter future ahead)
item.description: It's no secret that South Carolina ranks behind other states when it comes to education. With school starting back up this month, let’s look at some recent education figures and talk about what can be done to turn things around.
item.author: sam@scpolicycouncil.org (Sam Aaron)

item.title: Why SC should pass both school choice proposals
item.description: Update 3/16/23: After adopting the Finance Committee’s amendment and adding several other amendments on the floor, the full Senate passed S.285 by a vote of 28-9.
item.author: sam@scpolicycouncil.org (Sam Aaron)

item.title: SC’s special-needs scholarship program needs reform
item.description: TWO LEGISLATIVE PROPOSALS HAVE BIG POTENTIAL By Sam Aaron and Bryce Fiedler Despite good intentions, South Carolina’s special-needs scholarship program is failing to meet its goals, and major change is needed to ensure the state’s roughly 100,000 children with disabilities are getting the education services they need.
item.author: sam@scpolicycouncil.org (Sam Aaron)

item.title: Analysis: Blurring the line between education and job training
item.description: Update as of 2/12/22: H.4766, which would add more seats and give more power to the Coordinating Council for Workforce Development, passed the S.C. House on Feb. 8.
item.author: bryce@scpolicycouncil.org (Bryce Fiedler)
